channel.title: Max Cash
channel.description: Hi guys The max cash a player can hold is 2147m How can i fix this or change the max value?

item.title: Max Cash
item.dc:creator: @sonicforce41 sonicforce41
item.description:
@sonicforce41 wrote:

It would be wise not to mess around with these things if you have little knowledge of Java.

Read full topic

@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“DAn0194, post:13, topic:536075”]Your actually wrong you need to put the the L at the end of the value of the variable;

item.title: Max Cash
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:10, topic:536075”][quote author=Dollabillz link=topic=654879.msg4385779#msg4385779 date=1385490197]

Right now your cash is handled by an integer if you really need for it to be bigger you can use a long it holds 9223372036854775807

Note* You must have 64 bit java to use that long. 32 bit java only allows numbers to go to Integer.MAX_VALUE (2.147m)

How do i use Long? i have 64 bit java
[/quote]

/*
* Examples of using 'long'
*/
public long playerID = 584375847;
public long playerMath;
public long[] items = new long[14];//Array of longs style 1
public long[] bankItems = {
5645645, 54652, 87973627, 238462
};//Another array of longs

You asked how to use a long… I hope that helps.

Anyways, you basically want to change an int to a long, it really isn’t hard at all.[/quote]

Your actually wrong you need to put the the L at the end of the value of the variable;

Read full topic

item.description:
@Stenen wrote:

But dont forget, players with 32 bit java crash if you use 64 bit. So for putting it online you can better do 32 bit ( so 2147m max). But ofc you can do a few things without changing the Bit like tickets of 100M gp ea, 2147 tickets of 100m ea is alot money ^^

Anyways, you basically want to change an int to a long, it really isn’t hard at all.

item.title: Max Cash
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

If you’re willing to learn how these things work in Java, which will give you a better understanding of what you’re doing, take some time to click on those two links I showed you. The first one explains what primitive data types are and how they work (i.e. [tt]int, long, double, char, boolean[/tt]). The second link explains Inheritance, which essentially is inheriting methods and code from other classes. If you want to learn specifically about casting in Java, which is basically just converting one data type into another compatible data type (i.e [tt]int example = (double)2.9;[/tt] <-this code casts [converts] the integer variable “example” from an integer, which can hold only whole numbers, into a double, which can hold decimal numbers, otherwise known as floating-point numbers).

Read full topic

item.title: Max Cash
item.dc:creator: @Dollabillz Dollabillz
item.description:
@Dollabillz wrote:

[quote=“Flame_, post:2, topic:536075”]Gold in RuneScape is stored as an integer data type (i.e. [tt]int coins = 3;[/tt]). In Java, the maximum number an integer data type can store is 2[sup]31[/sup]-1, or 2,147,483,647. In order to increase the maximum amount of coins that can be held, you can cast the integer to a long and work around that, or concoct some way to have more than one cash stack in your bank/inventory.

Source: Primitive Data Types, Inheritance.[/quote]
So this is no way to change it?
Sorry i don’t really understand this my english is not too well

Read full topic

item.title: Max Cash
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Gold in RuneScape is stored as an integer data type (i.e. [tt]int coins = 3;[/tt]). In Java, the maximum number an integer data type can store is 2[sup]31[/sup]-1, or 2,147,483,647. In order to increase the maximum amount of coins that can be held, you can cast the integer to a long and work around that, or concoct some way to have more than one cash stack in your bank/inventory.

Source: Primitive Data Types, Inheritance.

Read full topic
